card.text: Wheaton uses Elms for student housing.
Elms was used as a dormitory by the private girls' school House in the Pines until the school closed in 1972.
In 1991 the students living here were mentors for students in the Attleboro elementary and middle schools.

Currently, the house is called "Outdoor's House" and houses students interested in outdoor activities such as hiking and camping. The house organizes trips, and forges paths through the Wheaton woods.
